title: 111_hr6339
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veteran Medic Corpsmen Physician Assistant Demonstration Program Act of 2010". It establishes the Physician Assistant Military Pathways Program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in collaboration with other departments, will establish a program to help eligible individuals with military medical skills become physician assistants to meet the demand. A study will be conducted to assess the effectiveness of demonstration projects in improving the ability of individuals to become licensed physician assistants. The program aims to assist eligible individuals with military medical skills in becoming physician assistants. It will assess the effectiveness of demonstration projects in providing educational support services for completing physician assistant education and obtaining certification. Ways of informing eligible individuals about the projects include the Transition Assistance Program and veterans transition program. The Secretary will award grants to eligible entities for demonstration programs to help eligible individuals obtain certification in healthcare fields. The eligible individuals can receive academic credit from an accredited physician assistant program based on military credentials and medical skills experience. Priority admission is given to those who have served as paramedics or in similar medical support positions in the Armed Forces. An examination eligibility requirement must be met for participation in the program. Eligible entities can receive funds to support Physician Assistant National Certifying Exam eligibility upon program completion. Application requirements include demonstrating capability to work with individuals and a history of collaboration with healthcare employers. The Secretary will establish selection criteria for eligible entities to receive funds for Physician Assistant National Certifying Exam eligibility. Priority will be given to entities showing the ability to sustain the program after the grant period. Technical assistance will be provided by the Secretary. The Secretary will provide technical assistance to eligible entities receiving grants under this subsection. Additionally, the Secretary will submit an annual report to Congress and Federal agencies on the program's findings and outcomes, including results of the study and information on eligible entities and participants in the demonstration program. The Secretary will distribute a report from the demonstration program to veterans' service organizations and State medical licensing boards. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "eligible individual" refers to someone with medical or health professional experience gained in the Armed Forces, who has received training in a health-related field, participated in delivering healthcare services, but does not hold a doctor of medicine or doctor of osteopathy degree. An eligible entity is an institution of higher education with a physician assistant program accredited by the Accreditation Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant, offering a doctor of medicine, doctor of osteopathy, or doctor of dentistry degree. Authorization of appropriations for this Act includes $4,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2016.
